# Tender Announcement: Bid Invitation NSFRV RFP Build

## Overview

The Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC), on behalf of the Fisheries and Oceans Canada, is issuing a bid invitation for the construction of a new Near Shore Fishery Research Vessel (NSFRV).

## Procurement Details

* Bid Invitation Number: PW-__MC-040-28811
* Solicitation Number: F7013-220306/A
* Last Amendment Number: 18
* Publication Date: September 21, 2022
* Tender Closing Date: May 19, 2023 at 14:00 EDT
* Expected Contract Start Date: None
* Expected Contract End Date: None
* Current Tender Status: Expiring

## Subject Matter and Goods/Services Required

The Department of Fisheries and Oceans (DFO) and the Canadian Coast Guard (CCG) require a Near Shore Fishery Research Vessel (NSFRV) for oceanographic science and secondary missions consistent with search and rescue and environmental response.

## Bidding and Evaluation Criteria

* Trade Agreement: Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* Tendering Procedures: Competitive - Open Bidding
* Competitive Procurement Strategy: Best Overall Proposal
* Comprehensive Land Claim Agreement: No
* Mandatory Indigenous Participation Component: 1%
* Bidding and Evaluation Criteria are outlined in the attached documents

## Contracting Entity and Deliverables

* Contracting Entity: Public Works and Government Services Canada
* Project Manager: Stephane Deslauriers
* Contact Information: [stephanedeslauriers@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:stephanedeslauriers@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)

## Important Documents

* Notice of Proposal (NRP) and Related Documents
* Bidder Instructions and Part 3 of the Bid Preparation Instructions
* Mandatory Technical Evaluation Criteria and Technical Point Rated Evaluation Criteria in Annex P
* NSFRV Design Instruction and Guidance document

## Closing Date and Time

May 19, 2023 at 14:00:00 EDT

## Epost Requirements

The epost Connect service provided by Canada Post Corporation must be used by Bidders to transmit their bid electronically.

## Language

Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada (English or French).
